item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, January 22, 2025 at 10:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Ross Ulbricht granted a full pardon (1070 points | 1092 comments)
2. Stargate Project: SoftBank, OpenAI, Oracle, MGX to build data centers (659 points | 715 comments)
3. Arm releases Chiplet System Architecture spec beta version (29 points | 8 comments)
4. 0-click deanonymization attack targeting Signal, Discord, other platforms (1221 points | 386 comments)
5. Infinigen (120 points | 10 comments)
6. Moving on from React, a year later (225 points | 129 comments)
7. Hunyuan3D 2.0 – High-Resolution 3D Assets Generation (212 points | 94 comments)
8. Isolating complexity is the essence of successful abstractions (102 points | 27 comments)
9. The testing pyramid is an outdated economic model (9 points | discuss)
10. Tensor Product Attention Is All You Need (69 points | 46 comments)
11. Invisible Electrostatic Wall at 3M plant (1996) (340 points | 166 comments)
12. Icelandic turf houses: Laufas, Glaumbaer and others (19 points | 5 comments)
13. Calm tech certification "rewards" less distracting tech (282 points | 77 comments)
14. Flame: A small language model for spreadsheet formulas (2023) (31 points | 2 comments)
15. Why is zero plural? (2024) (61 points | 99 comments)
16. What are these bumps on the top of a pull-tab can? (169 points | 17 comments)
17. Castle Game Engine: Web target – big progress, first 3 demos to try (75 points | 13 comments)
18. Life in Another Light, 2024 Infrared-Photography-Contest Winners (10 points | 3 comments)
19. The first release of OpenVox, the OSS implementation of Puppet (31 points | 13 comments)
20. Mercator: Extreme (158 points | 34 comments)
21. Open-source browser port of Pitfall from the Atari 2600 (59 points | 15 comments)
22. Ask HN: Is anyone doing anything cool with tiny language models? (403 points | 188 comments)
23. JReleaser: quick and effortless way to release your project (86 points | 23 comments)
24. Dissecting "Tiny Clouds" shadertoy (2017) (45 points | discuss)
25. Prime numbers so memorable that people hunt for them (137 points | 76 comments)
26. Sigstore: Making sure your software is what it claims to be (81 points | 24 comments)
27. Masters of Allusion: The Art of Poetic Reference (3 points | 1 comment)
28. Show HN: I made a app that uses NFC as a physical switch to block distractions (185 points | 97 comments)
29. Concept cells help your brain abstract information and build memories (107 points | 10 comments)
30. HyperDX (YC S22) is hiring engineers to build open source observability ( | hide)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, January 22, 2025 at 10:15 AM UTC
